Articles.Content: MattShea is back at playing KSP and sets himself the goal of creating a rover that seats two and drive it around on Mun. He certainly picked a location with a view to drive around at!
Are you kidding me?! I'm offended by (nope, aint gonna say it) Can't believe this. Holding my tongue.
Is this guy a Youtube star or something?
It really looks very nice. I like it!

> 
> Is this guy a Youtube star or something?

Yep. Apparently, SQUAD prefers showing off popular YouTubers' videos that would already get tens of thousands of views, and are relatively poor-quality. 

It does send the message, "Hey, [*insert popular YouTuber here*]! We appreciate the fact that you're showing off the game, and can you please continue doing so in the future?" But it also denies up-and-coming YouTubers from the chance of having their videos viewed by thousands of people. I think that the latter is far more important than the former.

...and don't get me started on the fact that this video is long, rambling, and vulgar. It's not very good, to be honest.

Again, just my $0.02... and I'm crabby this morning, so I might feel better about all of this tomorrow.

-Upsilon

900th post!

Instructions :

1. Know nothing about rovers

2. Start recording

3. Replicate rover design you saw in another video

4. Forget (If you ever knew it) the difference between Kerbin, Kerbal and "Kerbans"

5. Show how unstable the rover is

6. Get over 18.000 views on Youtube

7. Get featured in Video Wednesday

I kinda feel like you guys should promote good videos from unknown youtubers instead of meh videos from "famous" youtubers...

R.U.B.B.I.S.H.. hope the 1.0 is better then this... I actually pay/MB IE moneys is time of my life wasted at work instead of playing KSP.. Must be quite awesome to be a 7 year old with a grown up voice...

Anyway you'd almost think the Mods here are trolls..
